#7438 adds u • x with (u : units R) as the preferred spelling of ↑u • x, as it means we get all the lemmas about
units M for a monoid M for free from more general statements about a group G.

The scope has sprawled a little - does it still seem manageable, or should I attempt to break it up?

I draw attention to this because #7416 needs some definitions from it, and is currently having to duplicate them. If #7438 is almost ready to go, then there's no point duplicating them - but if it needs revisions, then it's probably sensible to wrap up @Jason KY.'s #7416 first.
